channel.title: Aliens, do they exist?
channel.description:
My theory is:
If alliens can fly so fast that they can travel from pluto to here in abt 4h lets say... If they where driving here we wouldn't be able to see them because the where travelling at lightspeed so thats when i think when i see UFO's videos (btw i think their all fake).

item.title: Aliens, do they exist?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Hex Key:

Your thinking of human life and other higher eukaryotes, bacterial life (and especially Archael life )grows all over the place. Even in nuclear reactors.

Mhmm I see.

Just read something very interesting,

London, Dec 12: A top UK space scientist Dr. John Murray has said that Mars could be lurking with killer aliens lying frozen beneath its surface.

He has said that bringing them to Earth will be catastrophic, as they will wipe out humanity.

Now Dr. Murray, who is also UK lead scientist with Europe’s Mars Express mission, has said he has overwhelming evidence of the life surviving in the frozen ocean near its equator, where simple life could thrive as microbes.

Prospects for life on Mars were boosted last week by NASA’s discovery of running water on the Red Planet, reports The Sun.

Dr. Murray believes the aliens are all lying in a dormant state. As such, a rocket should be used to blast a crater into ice floes in the region - named Elysium - allowing access to the aliens and water should be sprinkled on the dormant creatures to revive them.

“Then we could land a follow-up probe to scoop up the soil, put it under a microscope and add water,” he said.

However, the danger was in bringing them to Earth, he said.

“Both NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA) plan to bring samples of Mars 48million miles back to Earth in the next decade to be studied in a lab. That is where the danger lies,” he said.

“It is going to be extremely primitive life. We are talking about bacteria. The only danger is if we brought it back and it escaped, we could have a War Of The Worlds situation,” he added.

“Earth bacteria killed the invading Martians in that. The Martians brought to us could kill off humans. We’d best have a good look at things on Mars before bringing anything back,” he said.

Read full topic

item.title: Aliens, do they exist?

item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:41759”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=58405.msg715085#msg715085 date=1167597010]
There would have to be another planet that is the exact same distance from the sun that earth is.
[/quote]

Why? :/[/quote]
Because inorder for lifeforms to grow, there needs to be certain temperatures, and certain life conditions… Oxygen, etc…

item.title: Aliens, do they exist?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Just remember,

There would have to be another planet that is the exact same distance from the sun that earth is. Just don’t forget how big space is, it’s not a very good chance. But considering the billions of glaxies, and the trillions of planets… It’s too confusing. Too bad we didn’t have any more advanced space technology.

Read full topic

item.title: Aliens, do they exist?
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

Aliens exist. but not in the retarded sense your imagining.

Google: Panspermia

youll leanr alot of actual science if you do. Most panspermia science is bullshit btw, but science non the less.

Read full topic

item.title: Aliens, do they exist?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

If it takes them about 4 hours to get to pluto, it takes them roughly 1600 years to get to the nearest galaxy, and about 2500 if they’re lightspeed. I could be way off, it’s morning, but eitherway I pity them on inter-galactic flights.
